action.action-desc: Mr. Bishop of Utah (for himself, Mr. Lamborn, Mr. McClintock, Mr. Gosar, Mr. LaMalfa, and Mr. Westerman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend title 54, United States Code, to reform the Antiquities Act of 1906, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Monument Creation and Protection Act.

section.header: Limitation on size; clarification of eligible objects
section.text: Section 320301 of title 54, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking historic landmarks, historic and prehistoric structures, and other objects of historic or scientific interest and inserting object or objects of antiquity;

in subsection (b), by striking confined to the smallest area compatible with the proper care and management of the objects to be protected and inserting in accordance with the limitations outlined in subsections (e), (f), (g), and (h); and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Limitation on size of national monuments
subsection.text: Except as provided by subsections (f), (g), and (h), after the date of the enactment of this subsection, land may not be declared under this section in a configuration that would create a national monument—

paragraph.text: that is more than 640 acres; and
whose exterior boundary is less than 50 miles from the closest exterior boundary of another national monument declared under this section.

subsection.header: Exception for monuments of less than 5,000 acres
subsection.text: Subsection (e) shall not apply to the designation of a national monument under this section if the national monument so designated—

paragraph.text: would be less than 5,000 acres;
would have all exterior boundaries 50 miles or more from the closest exterior boundary of another national monument declared under this section; and
has been reviewed under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) by the Secretary of the Interior or the Secretary of Agriculture, as appropriate.

subsection.header: Exception for monuments of 5,000 acres and up to 10,000 acres

paragraph.text: Subsection (e) shall not apply to the designation of a national monument under this section if the national monument so designated—

subparagraph.text: would be at least 5,000 acres but not more than 10,000 acres; and
would have all exterior boundaries 50 miles or more from the closest exterior boundary of another national monument declaration under this section.

paragraph.text: A monument described in this subsection shall be subject to the preparation of an environmental assessment or environmental impact statement as part of a review under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.). The choice of environmental review document shall be within the discretion of the Secretary of the Interior or the Secretary of Agriculture, as appropriate.

subsection.header: Exception for monuments 10,000 acres and up to 85,000 acres
subsection.text: Subsection (e) shall not apply to the designation of a national monument under this section if the national monument so designated—

paragraph.text: would be at least 10,000 acres but not more than 85,000 acres;
would have all exterior boundaries 50 miles or more from the closest exterior boundary of another national monument declaration under this section; and

has been approved by the elected governing body of each county (or county equivalent), the legislature of each State, and the Governor of each State within whose boundaries the national monument will be located (and the Governor of each such State has transmitted a copy of each such approval to the President).

Subsection (e) shall not apply to the designation under this section of a national monument of any acreage amount if designation is made to prevent imminent and irreparable harm to the object or objects of antiquity to be protected by the designation.
A national monument designation under this subsection shall terminate on the date that is one calendar year after the date of the designation.
Land designated as a national monument under this subsection—

subparagraph.text: may only be so designated one time; and
may not also be permanently designated as a national monument under this section.

paragraph.text: Land designated as a national monument under this subsection shall remain subject to—

subparagraph.text: uses allowed on the day before such designation under an applicable Resource Management Plan or Forest Plan.

subsection.header: Presidential authority To reduce size of declared monuments

paragraph.text: reduce the size of any national monument declared under this section by 85,000 acres or less; or
reduce the size of any national monument declared under this section by more than 85,000 acres only if the reduction—

subparagraph.text: has been approved by the elected governing body of each county (or county equivalent), the legislature of each State, and the Governor of each State within whose boundaries the national monument will be located (and the Governor of each such State has transmitted a copy of each such approval to the President); and
has been reviewed under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) by the Secretary of the Interior or the Secretary of Agriculture, as appropriate.

subsection.text: After the date of the enactment of this subsection, land may not be declared as a national monument under this section in a configuration that would place non-federally owned property within the exterior boundaries of the national monument without the express written consent of the owners of that non-federally owned property.

subsection.header: Effect of declaration on federal funds
subsection.text: No declaration under this section shall be construed to increase the amount of Federal funds that are authorized to be appropriated for any fiscal year.

subsection.header: Water rights associated with a declaration
subsection.text: Water rights associated with a declaration under this section—

paragraph.text: may not be reserved expressly or by implication by a declaration under this section; and
may be acquired for a declaration under this section only in accordance with the laws of the State in which the water rights are based.

subsection.text: For the purposes of this section:

paragraph.text: The terms declaration and declared shall only include the creation or expansion of a national monument under this section.
The term land shall not include submerged land or water.

subparagraph.text: The term object or objects of antiquity means—

clause.text: certain buildings constructed before the date of the enactment of this subsection.

subparagraph.text: The term object or objects of antiquity does not include—

clause.text: objects not made by humans, except fossils (other than fossil fuels) or human or animal skeletal remains.
